CatDescriptText: Mr. William F. Bagley, machinist, Wilmerding, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 9, 1961, pg. 5 with question: "Do you think that in the final analysis, the uncommitted darker nations will join the democratic (pro-Western) or Communistic bloc?  Why?" answer reads: "I think they will join the democratic nations, because democracy believes that everyone contains a certain amount of honesty, and desires equality and goodwill for everyone.  This is what democracy stands for whereas the other regime is that for a one sided government where you either toe the line or you're not in."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of William F. Bagley wearing dark flecked suit jacket, necktie with rows of dots, eyeglasses, and hat, standing in front of structure; Portrait of man wearing polka dot button down collared shirt with short sleeves, standing in front of telephone booth
